item.title: By: Jonathan Shock

item.content:encoded: Hi Jess, that’s the plan

item.title: By: Jess Bourn
item.dc:creator: Jess Bourn
item.description: This is so useful and really well explained. It's very helpful to be able to see these Mathemafrica posts before coming to the lectures as it makes the lecture so much easier to follow. Would it be possible to make these pre-lecture posts a regular thing? Even if not for all lectures, just the ones that you think might be the harder ones to follow? It makes learning a lot easier!
item.content:encoded: This is so useful and really well explained. It’s very helpful to be able to see these Mathemafrica posts before coming to the lectures as it makes the lecture so much easier to follow. Would it be possible to make these pre-lecture posts a regular thing? Even if not for all lectures, just the ones that you think might be the harder ones to follow? It makes learning a lot easier!

item.title: By: Jonathan Shock
item.dc:creator: Jonathan Shock
item.description:
Hi Mackk, do you want to pop by during office hours and we can talk through this example. You certainly should be getting the same answer...
All the best,
J

item.title: By: mackk

item.description: Jon i get 1/2x^2lnx-1/2x^2 if i swap u and dv
